showcases.title: Design System
showcases.description: A design system in code
showcases.context: CloudGuard suffered from inconsistency everywhere; Existing system missed functionality and scalability.
deliveries: Architected and built a code-based design system directly in React and Tailwind
Developed reusable components with tokens (colors, typography, spacing, icons) to guarantee consistency.
Enabled designers and engineers to collaborate on a shared source of truth.
Championed responsiveness at the system level.
Partnered with developers to ensure production-ready components and smooth adoption.
Streamlined icons management and deployment
Incorporated third-party components for better quality and efficiency
impact: Brought visual consistency across large parts of the product
Established a single source of truth for design and development, reducing duplication and misalignment.
Improved collaboration: designers and engineers could speak the same language and reuse the same building blocks.
Drastically reduced time spent by the FE team on components maintenance

showcases.title: Color System
showcases.description: A flexible and potent color system
showcases.context: The product had grown over many years, accumulating inconsistent and outdated color usage across its interface. Many colors were unrelated, redundant, or inaccessible, making maintenance difficult and harming visual coherence.The goal was to create a unified, flexible color system that could replace legacy colors, ensure accessibility, and provide a clear, scalable foundation for future design work.
deliveries: Conducted a comprehensive audit of all colors used across the product to identify duplicates, inconsistencies, and accessibility issues.
Designed a new structured color system built around semantic tokens (e.g., primary, success, warning, neutral).
Defined contrast-safe color scales supporting accessibility standards and visual hierarchy.
Replaced legacy hard-coded colors with centralized tokens ready for implementation in design and code.
Documented the system in Figma and developer guidelines to ensure easy adoption and long-term maintenance.
impact: Eliminated hundreds of redundant or outdated colors, significantly simplifying visual management.
Improved accessibility and readability, ensuring compliance with contrast standards.
Unified design and engineering teams around a single, maintainable color source.
Strengthened the overall visual consistency and professionalism of the product’s interface.

showcases.title: Blueberry
showcases.caption: Internal prototyping tool built on production components and tokens.
showcases.description: Internal prototyping tool that uses same Design System and components as production
showcases.context: Design teams often struggle to create realistic prototypes that matched the production environment. Traditional tools required rebuilding components visually, which caused visual drift and wasted time. To solve this, I created Blueberry — an internal prototyping tool built directly on top of the production design system, ensuring pixel-perfect accuracy and real interaction behavior.
deliveries: Designed and developed an interactive prototyping tool that uses live production components.
Implemented the same design tokens, theming, and logic as in the production system.
Created hundreds prototypes and several POCs.
impact: Enabled designers to prototype in a real environment, reducing design-to-dev friction.
Ensured 1:1 visual and behavioral consistency between prototypes and shipped features.
Shortened iteration cycles by removing the need to rebuild components for mockups.
Improved communication and alignment between design and engineering teams.
Strengthened adoption of the shared design system by demonstrating its flexibility and power.

showcases.title: Main Dashboard
showcases.description: A POC of main dashboard
showcases.context: CloudGuard’s leadership needed a clear, high-level visualization of risk posture and prevention performance across the product ecosystem.Existing dashboards were fragmented and too detailed, making it difficult for executives to understand trends or communicate impact.The goal was to create a proof of concept for a unified main dashboard — one that simplifies complex data into a clear, actionable story for both technical and strategic stakeholders.
deliveries: Designed a high-fidelity proof of concept for the CloudGuard main dashboard.
Developed visual models for risk, prevention, and asset health metrics.
Introduced data visualization patterns for performance trends and alerts.
Defined layout, hierarchy, and visual language for executive-level clarity.
Collaborated closely with the Chief Strategy Officer to align design with business insights and messaging.
impact: Helped leadership visualize product value at a glance, enabling clearer communication with customers and partners.
Simplified complex risk data into an intuitive, narrative-driven dashboard.

showcases.title: Full UI redesign
showcases.description: A full redesign of CloudGuard’s user interface
showcases.context: CloudGuard’s interface had become visually outdated and inconsistent across modules. Screens were cluttered, color usage lacked hierarchy, and icons varied between screens. The redesign aimed to modernize the UI, align it with the new design system, and improve overall usability and brand perception.
deliveries: Conducted competitive benchmarking and visual audits• Defined visual direction aligned with company rebranding• Built a scalable design system in Figma• Produced high-fidelity screens and interaction specifications for implementation
impact: Unified UI across all CloudGuard modules, improving visual consistency and clarity
Reduced visual complexity and improved user task completion through cleaner layouts and better hierarchy
Provided a solid visual and structural foundation for future product scalability

showcases.title: Icons System
showcases.description: Part of the Design System in Figma — a flexible and scalable icon framework for CloudGuard
showcases.context: As part of Check Point’s visual redesign, CloudGuard’s iconography needed a full overhaul. Existing icons were inconsistent in style. The goal was to establish a unified, maintainable system aligned with the new brand direction.
deliveries: Redesigned the entire icon library in a consistent line (stroke) style
Implemented a build method (in Figma and code) that enables dynamic icon weight adjustments similar to font weights
Defined a scalable system of icon sizes and weights
impact: Unified iconography across all CloudGuard modules and Check Point’s design ecosystem
Reduced visual noise and improved UI consistency across multiple teams and products

showcases.title: Automated Actions
showcases.description: Design of the Automated Actions flow for CloudGuard, enabling users to define and manage automatic responses to specific security events.
showcases.context: As part of introducing a new mechanism for detecting and alerting on “toxic combinations” (risky security configurations), there was a need to design a clear and flexible flow that would let users automate responses and control notification rules — ensuring alerts remain meaningful and actionable rather than overwhelming.
deliveries: Gathered design references and explored automation patterns from similar enterprise products
Defined user flows and logic for filtering and triggering automated actions
Designed high-fidelity mockups for configuration and test result views
impact: Enabled the successful rollout of a new “Toxic Combinations” alerting feature with clear and actionable automation options
Helped users gain confidence and control over alerting behavior by reducing noise and emphasizing relevance
Strengthened CloudGuard’s position as a proactive, automation-driven security platform

showcases.title: Entity Details redesign
showcases.description: Redesign of the entity details view to improve usability and clarity
showcases.context: As part of the larger CloudGuard UI redesign, the entity details view required special attention. The previous design was cluttered and inconsistent, with poor information hierarchy, confusing labels, and uneven behavior across entity types. Users struggled to locate key information quickly, reducing efficiency and confidence in the tool.
deliveries: Gathered visual and structural references
Designed new wireframes for all entity types, adapting layouts for specific data structures
Defined information hierarchy and labeling standards
Created high-fidelity designs aligned with the new UI system
impact: Simplified and unified the entity details experience across modules
Reduced user confusion and cognitive load by improving data grouping and labeling
Provided a scalable framework for future entity types

showcases.title: Event Graph
showcases.description: A redesign of the main visualization in the Event Details view — showing how assets and events are connected in a clear, interactive graph.
showcases.context: Security analysts needed a more intuitive way to visualize how an event propagated through affected assets and related components. The previous representation was flat and text-heavy, making it difficult to understand relationships between entities and the overall attack flow.
deliveries: Conducted research into visualization patterns for complex relationships
Defined visual hierarchy and interaction model for event-to-asset mapping
Created high-fidelity designs aligned with the new CloudGuard UI system
impact: Enabled analysts to understand event context at a glance
Reduced time to investigate incidents by presenting relationships visually
Provided a scalable foundation for other graph-based visualizations in CloudGuard

showcases.title: Entity Viewer redesign
showcases.description: A proof of concept for redesigning the Entity Viewer UX to make complex data structures more understandable and accessible.
showcases.context: The existing Entity Viewer was highly technical and text-heavy, catering mainly to users with deep R&D backgrounds. The goal was to make entity data easier to explore for a broader audience by improving hierarchy, visual grouping, and discoverability — while maintaining accuracy for advanced users.
deliveries: Conducted UX research to identify usability barriers in the current viewer
Designed and implemented a high-fidelity interactive prototype directly in code
Reused production components to ensure design feasibility and performance parity
impact: Validated a more approachable way to explore complex data structures
Helped align stakeholders on the need to simplify the Entity Viewer experience
Served as a reference for future UI and UX directions within the platform

showcases.title: Main layout
showcases.description: Design of the main editing layout for Subber’s video subtitle editor — defining how users interact with subtitles and video simultaneously.
showcases.context: The challenge was to deliver rich editing functionality within a compact interface, ensuring the controls enhanced rather than obstructed the video playback experience.
deliveries: Conducted research on user interaction patterns in video editing and subtitle creation environments
Explored and compared multiple layout directions and interaction models
Refined and finalized the selected “Above-Video” layout concept
Designed a transparent, context-aware interface that minimizes visual obstruction
Delivered a scalable, nonintrusive, and visually cohesive layout aligned with Subber’s product aesthetic
impact: The “Above-Video” layout introduced a scalable structure that enabled complex interactions without obstructing playback. It became the foundation for future layout decisions across the product.

impact: Elevated the visual quality of the product by introducing a sleek, consistent subtitle design that communicated both precision and playfulness.
